page.title: 12Building your own house.
page.content: We lived in a caravan for six months while we built our own house. It was cramped, with three children and our parents. Charlotte was only two. We had no water or electricity in the van, and no TV. Mum washed outside with a tub and the mangle. At night, the tables had to be folded away before the beds were made. Dad did the foundations himself, and we all poured in the hard-core. In the winter of '81, dad had to unfreeze the gas-bottle tap each morning. The van got wet and our things were damp. We all wrote our names on our bedroom walls before the floors were down. All the children on the self-build made dens with bricks and planks in the mounds of dirt. Some families are building second houses, but my mum said "never again". STEWART COTTERILL aged 10
